ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about concrete poetry in Brazil and internationally. I also learned more about the broader history of "experimental" literary movements in 20th- and 21st-century Brazil.
I gained an understanding of the work of the main figures of Brazilian & Portuguese concrete poetry, as well as of the history of the genre as a whole.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The readings were rich, interesting, and well organized. I also appreciated the freedom afforded to undergraduates in choosing essay topics. Professor Jackson encouraged students to come each week with specific poems and poets to discuss or present, a structure that, at its best, made for a lively in-class atmosphere.

A strength is, as always, Professor David Jackson's unmatched knowledge on the subject and his personal history with some of the big names in the course. He is a wealth of wisdom and does a great job selecting the works and artists we focus on in the course. One thing I wish we had spent more time on is discussing more of the theory and current state of the genre in class, as a lot of it was isolated to the readings, and I think it would have made for very engaging and intriguing class discussions.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Comprehensive intro to concrete poetry

I would recommend this course to any student interested in Brazilian literature, avant-garde movements or manifestos, and/or the Portuguese language. I knew very little about the subject matter coming in and am really glad I took the plunge.
Yes--it is a great opportunity to learn more about a somewhat obscure form of poetry and a fascinating art movement.
